sen.j: 鎌倉時代は江北六郡の地頭であり、始祖の佐々木氏信は鎌倉幕府の評定衆を務め、後を継いだ佐々木宗綱は、幕府が朝廷に対し天皇の譲位を促した際の使者を務めている。
sen.e: In the Kamakura period the clan was an estate steward of six counties in Gohoku, and the original forefather Ujinobu SASAKI became High Court of Justice of Kamakura Bakufu (the shogunate), and Munetsuna SASAKI who inherited Ujinobu worked as an envoy at the time when the Shogunate prompted the Imperial Court to pass the throne to the successor.

sen.cmt: THE→Theに修正しました。鎌倉幕府の表現を修正しました。Shogunate→bakufuに修正しました。

tit.cmt: 前出のためローマ字表記のみとしました。

sen.j: 鎌倉時代末期に当主となった佐々木道誉（高氏）は、朝廷で検非違使、鎌倉幕府で御相伴衆を務めていたが、元弘3年（1333年）に後醍醐天皇の綸旨を受けた足利尊氏が倒幕の兵を挙げると、それに寄与し建武の新政に加わる。
sen.e: Doyo SASAKI (Takauji) who became the family head at the end of the Kamakura period worked as Kebiishi, officers having function of police and judge, in the Imperial court and as gosobanshu, an advisor in the Kamakura Shogunate, but in 1333 when Takauji ASHIKAGA received the order of Emperor Go-Daigo to topple the Shogunate Doyo contributed to it and was involved in the new administration.

Doyo SASAKI (Takauji) who became the family head, at the end of the Kamakura period, worked as Kebiishi, officers having function of police and judge, in the Imperial court and as gosobanshu, an advisor in the Kamakura Shogunate, but in 1333 when Takauji ASHIKAGA received the order from Emperor Go-Daigo to topple the Shogunate, Doyo contributed to it and was involved in the new administration.

sen.cmt: Shogunate→bakufuに修正しました(前出のためローマ字表記のみ)。天皇名の表記をGo-Daigo→Godaigoに修正しました。"the" を挿入しました。

sen.j: しかし建武の新政は武士の支持を得られず、建武 (日本)2年（1335年）に北条時行らが中先代の乱を起こし鎌倉を占拠すると、道誉は尊氏に従い討伐へと向かい、相模川で時行軍の背後を奇襲し勝利に寄与する。
sen.e: However, Kemmu Restoration of imperial government could not draw support from samurai warriors, and in 1335 when Tokiyuki HOJO and others staged the Chusendai war and occupied Kamakura, Doyo followed Takauji and went out for suppression, and made a sneak attack from the back of the Tokiyuki army in the Sagamigawa River and contributed to the victory.

sen.cmt: Kemmu→Kenmuに修正しました。「中先代の乱」の読みの誤りを修正しました(Chusendai→Nakasendai)。

sen.j: 尊氏が鎌倉に入り幕府設立の動きを見せ、朝廷が新田義貞を総大将とする尊氏の討伐軍を発すると、道誉は尊氏軍として義貞軍と矢作川で戦うが敗れ、手超河原では弟の佐々木貞満も討たれ一旦は義貞に下るが、次の箱根の戦いでは尊氏方として戦い勝利する。
sen.e: When Takauji moved into Kamakura and started establishing the Shogunate while the Imperial court sent the subjugating army led by the grand leader Yoshisada NITTA to defeat Takauji, Doyo, as the Takauji army, fought against the Yoshisada army in Yahagi River but was defeated, and his younger brother Mitsusada SASAKI was also defeated by Yoshisada in the Tegoegawara river to once yield, but in the next battle of Hakone they fought on the side of Takauji army to end in victory for them.

sen.cmt: Shogunate→bakufuに修正しました。Yahagi-gawa Riverとしました。"the"を挿入しました。

sen.j: 延元3年/暦応元年（1338年）、後醍醐天皇らを吉野に追った尊氏が、京で持明院統の光明天皇から征夷大将軍に任ぜられ室町幕府が開かれると、道誉は功績を評され引付衆、評定衆、政所、近江国、飛騨国、出雲国、若狭国、上総国、摂津国の守護を務めることとなる。
sen.e: In 1338 when Takauji who expelled Emperor Go-Daigo and others to Yoshino was appointed to Shogun by Emperor Komyo of Jimyoin Line in Kyoto and the Muromachi Shogunate was opened, Doyo's contribution was recognized and he took the positions of Hikitsukeshu, trial officers, Hyojosho, Council of State, Mandokoro (the Office of Administration), and Shugo (military governor) of the Province of Omi, Hida, Izumo, Wakasa, Kazusa, and Settsu.

sen.cmt: Emperor Godaigo、Muromachi bakufuとしました。Hyojosho→Hyojoshuに修正、およびProvinceを複数形にしました。コンマでの区切りを一部カッコに変更しました。

sen.j: 興国元年/暦応3年（1340年）、道誉と長男の佐々木秀綱は、家臣が光厳天皇の弟である妙法院の御所の僧兵に殴打された事を怒り、御所に火をかけ建仁寺を延焼させる。
sen.e: In 1340, Doyo and his eldest son Hidetsuna SASAKI got angry about the incident that their subjects were beat up by soldier priests of the Imperial Court of Myohoin who was the youngest brother of Emperor Kogen, and put fire on the Imperial Court to burn Ken'nin-ji Temple.

sen.j: 延暦寺は朝廷と幕府に二人の死罪を求めるが、幕府はこれを放置し、延暦寺がさらに強く抗議を行った結果、二人は上総国山辺郡へ一時流されるが、その道中は道々で酒席を設け宿々で美女を弄び、流人には見えなかったと言う。
sen.e: En'ryaku-ji Temple requested the Imperial Court and the Shogunate to sentence the two to death, but the Shogunate ignored the request, and En'ryaku-ji Temple strongly protested, whereby the two were temporarily exiled to Yamabe County, the Province of Kazusa, but it is said that they did not look like exiles since they had banquets and had women on their way.

sen.j: その後の南北朝の戦いでは、正平 (日本)3年/貞和4年（1348年）の四條畷の戦いで、道誉は二千余騎を率いて参じ、楠正行軍を撃退するが、その後の戦いで次男の佐々木秀宗が討たれる。

sen.e: In 1353, Hidetsuna who took the position of chief of the Office of Samurai was killed while he protected Emperor Gokogen, Yoshiakira ASHIKAGA, and others who were expelled from Kyoto, and in 1362 hideakira SASAKI brothers who were sons of Hidetsuna were killed in the battle of Settsu Kanzaki bridge.
